steps.title: In-Irons
steps.instructions:
## Learn to taste and rate specialty coffees
1. Trees
2. Beans
3. Processes
4. Cupping Overview
5. Cupping

steps.title: Trees
steps.instructions:
## _Coffea_ (genus)
- Coffee grows on trees
- Coffee is inside the coffee cherry
- The coffee tree uses caffeine to defend against herbivores
- Over 6,500 species of trees
- Grows up to 8 meters tall
- Coffee is growing for 3-5 months of the year

steps.title: Beans
steps.instructions:
## Arabica & Robusta
### Arabica
- ~70% of coffee is Arabica (all specialty coffees)
- Can have floral, fruity, earthy notes
- Susceptible to pests
### Robusta
- Can have bitter, charcoal taste
- Much less susceptible to pests

steps.title: Process
steps.instructions:
## Washed & Dry Process
### Washed
- Coffee cherries are washed to remove the cherry fruit husk
- Flavors often have earthy/more subtle characteristics
### Dry Process
- Fruit is left on, coffee then dries on flat beds/concrete landings
- Maintains fruitier/distinct flavors

steps.title: Cupping Overview
steps.instructions:
### Process
1. Fragance & aroma
2. Flavor, Aftertaste, Acidity, Body, & Balance
3. Sweetness, Uniformity, & Cleanliness
4. Scoring

steps.title: Fragance & aroma
steps.instructions:
1. Smell the ground coffee in cups
2. Wet the coffee with water in a 1:15 ratio
3. Wait 4 minutes
4. Break the crust and smell again
5. Finish fragrance scoring

steps.title: Flavor, Aftertaste, Acidity, Body, & Balance
steps.instructions:
1. Wait 6 minutes for cups to cool to ~140 deg
2. Slurp samples of each coffee, rate the flavor, aftertaste, acidity, body, and balance

steps.title: Sweetness, Uniformity, & Cleanliness
steps.instructions:
1. Wait 5 minutes for cups to cool ~120 deg
2. Slurp coffees again, this time scoring sweetness, uniformity, and cleanliness

steps.title: Scoring
steps.instructions:
1. Fill out the score card, add up points from each coffee
2. Talk about each cup briefly, before the reveal
